intro: Sphondylium longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are elongated and have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. It is often found in Mediterranean regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
